summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from July 29-30, 2019, between attorneys coordinating a meeting location and time for the following day, July 31. The meeting involves a victim's attorney, the victim (referred to as 'M'), and other parties, and is scheduled to occur after a court status conference in Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case in New York. The emails discuss logistics, a potential third victim, and confirm Epstein's expected presence at the status conference.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein'; his criminal case status conference is scheduled for July 31, 2019, in New York, and it is confirmed he is expected to be present.

connections.description: M is a victim represented by an attorney in relation to the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by the context of the meeting and status conference.

events.title: Epstein Case Status Conference
events.description: A status conference for Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case is scheduled in court in New York at 11:00 AM. It is confirmed that Epstein is expected to be present.

events.title: Attorney-Victim Meeting Coordination
events.description: Attorneys coordinate a meeting for the afternoon of July 31, initially planned for 1:00 PM but potentially moved to 2:00 or 3:00 PM, to discuss case matters, including a third victim.

events.title: Potential New York Meeting with Third Victim
events.description: An attorney mentions a third victim they represent who would like to meet in New York in August, to be discussed at the July 31 meeting.

locations: Hotel (unspecified, referred to as 'my hotel' or 'Mhotel')
keyFacts: A status conference in Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case was scheduled for July 31, 2019, at 11:00 AM in New York, with Epstein expected to be present.
Attorneys were coordinating a meeting on July 31 involving a victim ('M') to discuss case matters, with logistics concerning meeting at a hotel versus an office.
An attorney referenced a third victim they represent who wished to meet in New York in August, indicating ongoing victim engagement.
The emails highlight the logistical coordination among legal teams and victims surrounding court proceedings in the Epstein case in late July 2019.
